All 1546 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES because they come from markdown documentation files containing examples of vulnerable code patterns for educational purposes. The skill provides read-only analysis tools (Read, Grep, Glob, Bash) to help developers identify and fix security issues.

content.user_title: Detect security vulnerabilities and audit code
content.value_statement: This skill provides expert guidance for identifying security vulnerabilities in code and implementing secure coding practices. It covers OWASP Top 10, authentication, authorization, cryptography, and secrets management.
actual_capabilities: Detect OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities in code
Review cryptographic implementations and secrets management
Provide secure coding recommendations and remediation guidance
limitations: Cannot execute code or perform live penetration testing
Limited to Read, Grep, Glob, and Bash for static analysis
Does not provide legal security compliance certification
Cannot access external APIs or third-party services

use_cases.title: Code Security Audits
use_cases.description: Conduct thorough security reviews of authentication, payments, and user data handling code

use_cases.title: Security Checklists
use_cases.description: Apply pre-deployment security checklists and OWASP Top 10 compliance verification

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this code for security vulnerabilities and identify OWASP Top 10 issues

prompt_templates.title: Auth Review

prompt_templates.title: Secure Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Help design a secure feature implementation following security best practices

prompt_templates.title: Remediation Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide detailed remediation guidance for the security vulnerabilities found in this code

output_examples.input: Audit this authentication module for security issues
output: Severity: HIGH - SQL Injection risk in login query
Description: User input directly concatenated into SQL query
Remediation: Use parameterized queries with prepared statements
Severity: LOW - Information disclosure in error messages
Recommendations: Use cryptographically secure random tokens, avoid revealing user existence

best_practices: Apply defense in depth with multiple security layers
Follow least privilege principles for all access controls
Fail securely by denying access by default on errors
anti_patterns: Using string concatenation for SQL queries
Storing secrets or keys directly in source code
Trusting client-side validation without server verification

faq.question: What security standards does this skill follow?
faq.answer: OWASP Top 10 2021 and industry best practices for secure development.

faq.question: Can this skill perform live penetration testing?
faq.answer: No, it provides static analysis guidance through read-only tools only.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Language-agnostic security principles applicable to any codebase.

faq.question: Does this skill replace security audits?
faq.answer: No, it assists but does not replace professional security assessments.

faq.question: Can it detect all vulnerability types?
faq.answer: Covers common web vulnerabilities; custom or niche issues may need specialized tools.

faq.question: What tools does it use for analysis?
faq.answer: Read, Grep, Glob, and Bash for static code examination.
